revised_title: Managing Residual Elements in Steel Production: Strategies and Control
tldr: This article discusses the challenges of managing residual elements in steel production, such as copper, tin, and nickel, which can cause hot shortness during processing. The authors propose strategies to control these elements, including producing low-residual casts, increasing nickel content, reducing scaling rates, and minimizing holding times at high temperatures. They also present a revised mathematical model to predict and quantify the degree of enrichment under various reheating conditions.
